creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: rectangular top frame divided by central stretcher, two cylindrical rollers set to either side, straight waist, beaded apron, short stout legs with hoof feet
text: Footstools were commonly used in combination with tall chairs and couches to support the feet. Those with rollers are mentioned in the 16th century carpenter's manual the Lu Pan Ching, and a contemporary book titled On Superfluous Things praises their stimulating effects: "Moving the feel back and forth over the rollers excites the vital energies to bubble upward like a fountain."
title: Footstool (gundeng)
